page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN WESTOWN
page.content: MANY PEOPLE HAVE DIFFICULTIES IN PARKING THEIR VEHICLES,ESPECIALLY THE CARS IN WESTOWN.IN THE SUMMER THE TOURISTS MAKE IT EVEN MORE DIFFICULT TO PARK AND GET AROUND.MANY PEOPLE WHO LIVE ON HAYLING USE THEIR CYCLES FOR SHOPPING AND GETTING AROUND.IN OUR AREA THERE IS ALSO A FERRY.IT RUNS FROM HAYLING TO PORTSMOUTH.A RETURN TICKET COSTS Â£0.50 FOR CHILDREN AND Â£1.00 FOR ADULTS.BUSES RUN REGULAR TRIPS ALL OVER THE ISLAND.THEY COME FROM MENGHAM(NOT IN OUR AREA).MANY CHILDREN GO HOME FROM SCHOOL BY BUS.ON SUNDAY,ABOUT 5 O'CLOCK IF IT'S NICE THERE ARE HUGE TRAFFIC JAMS FROM THE BEACH RIGHT OFF THE ISLAND.IT TAKES ABOUT THREE QUARTERS OF AN HOUR TO GET OFF THE ISLAND VISITORS ARE A BOOM TO THE TRADE.
